header.title: Introduction

section.title: Scope
section.p: The Tools application contains the following standalone tools, which are useful when developing Erlang programs:

item.p: Cover - A coverage analysis tool for Erlang.
Cprof - Measures how many times each function is called. Uses a kind of local call trace breakpoints containing counters to achieve very low runtime performance degradation.
Eprof - Measures how time is used in Erlang programs. It is a predecessor of Fprof.
Fprof - Measures how time is used in Erlang programs. Uses trace to file to minimize runtime performance impact, and displays time for calling and called functions.

Emacs - A package with erlang.el and erlang-start.el that provides support for Erlang in Emacs. Provides an editing mode with many bells and whistles, compilation support, and allows the user to start Erlang shells that run inside Emacs.
Instrument - Utility functions for obtaining and analyzing resource use in an instrumented Erlang runtime system.
Lcnt - A lock profiling tool for the Erlang runtime system.
Make - A make utility for Erlang similar to UNIX Make.
Tags - A tool for generating Emacs TAGS files from Erlang source files.
Xref - A cross reference tool that can be used to check dependencies between functions, modules, applications, and releases.

section.p: Information about the tools Instrument, Make, and Tags is provided in the Reference Manual only.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: It is assumed that the reader is familiar with the Erlang programming language.
